results.title: Gallipoli
results.creator_credit: George I. Malcolm, J McGrath, Frank Hunter, ABC and Supreme Sound Studios
results.brief_description: A recreation of the futile attempt to capture the straits of Bosphorous in 1915 in order to gain control of Constantinople. Shows the needles loss of life, caused by the poor command of Gallipoli, Cape Helles and Suvla Bay. Makes use of documentary footage. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: China mission
results.creator_credit: Tom Radford, Lydia Semotuk, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A biography of Chester Ronning told through the use of mostly contemporary stills and some silent footage. Chester Ronning was born in Francheng, China, in 1894, the son of Norwegian missionaries. Until his death at the age of ninety, he was everything from a cowboy to an ambassador, a college president to a Peace River homesteader, a missionary to a member of the Alberta legislature. But Ronning, who died in December 1984, is best remebered in international circles for his long and close relationship with China. Throughout his many careers, including that of Canadian High Commissioner to India, ambassador to Norway, and head of an international mission in 1966 to end the war in Vietnam, Ronning’s lifelong ambition was to explain China to the western world. His story is a rare example of the meeting of east and west in a compassionate, remarkable man. Narrated by Cedric Smith. (Awards: San Antonio; San Francisco).

results.title: What is ecology? - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates basic terms in the science of ecology. Explores plant and animal relationships and their interdependence for survival through several major biomes. Addresses the constant danger of human activity to the ecological balance.

results.title: Do you mind if I smoke?
results.creator_credit: Sue Woodford and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Investigates the dangers of passive smoking, ie the smoke inhaled by a non-smoker from cigarettes left burning in an ashtray or in someone’s hand. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Faces
results.brief_description:
Sue Ford’s experimental film “Faces” consists of portraits of the artist and her friends and acquaintances. Ford filmed each subject for roughly 25 seconds, using a wind-up Bolex camera that framed their faces in close-up. Variously self-conscious, serious, amused and distracted, the camera captures every small gesture, expression and flicker of emotion on the person’s face. The result is an examination of portraiture and the performance of identity, demonstrating the artist’s interest in using the camera to capture reality, time and change.

Participants in the film include artists Micky Allan, Bonita Ely and Paul Reed, among others.
results.description:
Sue Ford’s experimental film Faces consists of portraits of the artist and her friends and acquaintances. Each subject is framed in close-up and filmed for roughly 25 seconds at a time. Variously self-conscious, serious, nonchalant, curious, amused and distracted, the camera captures every small gesture, expression and flicker of emotion on the person’s face. The result is an examination of portraiture and the performance of identity, demonstrating the artist’s interest in using the camera to capture reality, time and change.

Participants in the film include artists Micky Allan, Bonita Ely and Paul Reed, among others.

results.title: Christo's valley curtain
results.creator_credit: Albert Maysles, David Maysles, Ellen Gifford, Thomas Handloser and Maysles Films, Inc.
results.brief_description: A documentary by the Maysles Brothers focusing on the construction of a five hundred foot valley curtain by Bulgarian artist Christo. Examines the erection of the veil across Rifle Gap (part of the Grand Canyon) and presents smaller art works by Christo which were used in preparation for the event.

results.title: The Atom: a closer look
results.creator_credit: Corporate Productions and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action to illustrate the history of atomic theory, the structure of the atom and its nucleus, how nuclear energy is generated, radiation and the problems of nuclear waste disposal. Although basically factual, the program stresses the fact that the atom is neither good nor evil, and that it is man’s responsibility to decide whether atomic power will either create or destroy. Made pre Chernobyl but an excellent introduction to atomic theory. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Overture: Linh from Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Seth Pinsker, Elaine Sperber and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Docudrama which tells about young Linh Tran and her family, who have settled into their first real home since immigrating to America from Vietnam. Discusses the social hardships they incur, the adjustments they must make to a new culture, and the girl’s friendship with a Mexican-American boy. Cast includes: Pandito Gomez, Kim Ngan Ly, Michael Leon and Stanley Brock
